title: Enhancing Creative Problem-Solving and Expression Skills Through Open Language Learning Projects

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic instructional design principles, language education methodologies (reading, writing, speaking, listening), and experience with digital tools
context.additional_context: Developing and applying open educational resources (writing/discussion/multimedia content) using digital media and collaborative learning tools. Focuses on enhancing critical thinking and language expression skills

learning_goals: Learners design three types of shareable language education content (grammar, vocabulary, reading comprehension activities) on an open learning platform
Using collaborative learning tools, learners develop two creative problem-solving prototypes (writing, discussion, presentation materials) based on peer feedback
Teams create and apply a digital media-based project evaluation rubric (organization, creativity, linguistic accuracy)
Learners achieve 80% or higher participation in team-based language discussions in an open learning environment
Through learner-generated content (LGC), learners improve creative problem-solving skills (text analysis, expression) by 20% compared to pre-post assessments

resources: University Open Learning Platform (LMS) Access Permissions
Openly Licensed Language Education Resource Library

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
